comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: DR. TIPPLE QUITS COLLEGE IN ROME; Methodist Board Is Told Ill ... New York Times - Nov 21, 1923 Dr. Bertrand M. Tipple as President of the Methodist College on the eighth hill of Rome, overlooking the Vatican, was accepted yesterday by the Board of ... 1923 tranche I started a biography in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bertrand_M._Tipple

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of Jan 26, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0A17FF3A5B13738... reported that Tipple had acquired a site in Rome to "erect a great modern college." books.google.com/books?id=tn7TAAAAMAAJ&pg=PA222&l... has his 1916 entry in Who's Who in American Methodism NYT of April 5, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F40B13FA3D5E13738... reported that his wife who was ill was sailing for the United States. NYT of March 10, 1919 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0913FD355D147A9... reported his support for the formation of the League of Nations. In 1924, his "Alien Rome" was published. See openlibrary.org/books/OL14053813M/Alien_Rome
